text: I put this school as one of my top 3 choices just because of its proximity to my house (30 min bus ride). The best teacher is MR MARK CHAN hands down. He's the only teacher who connected the subject (Physics at that time) to real-life application, making it easy to understand instead of relying on memorization.

Quite a big school, and all the seniors here are very welcoming. They were very kind to me and taught me how to use find a teacher in the staffroom in sec 1. The teachers are also quite friendly. Overall, quite a good school.

ive been a student here for almost 3 months and im loving it here its not as bad as what the reviews say tbh just need to mix with the right people and you'll be fine:) the teachers here are really caring and nice but some can be quite strict! there's a lot of events such as sjc spirit day/youthphoria , sjc galentines day , etc
i love sjc!!!
My daughter says is quite good so far for term one, even though this wasn't her top school choice. The WA1 is quite unique as most subjects are project based.

I got into this school Because it was my fifth choice (idk how many) This is my school now and although it is just the first year of school I don't rly like it
Students are kinda crazy maybe some of them actually have issues but I can't really say.
The teachers are all bad except for like 3 of my subject teachers.
And it's too strict whatsoever
Unless you are fine with being written done for being 5 minutes early
Everything is wrong and nothing is right
(Sure I'm not a popular kid maybe the ones that is average but you will find some friends)
